Technological Innovation for Personalized Surgery

The TIPS Lab is a dynamic, interdisciplinary team of researchers located at Purdue University’s Weldon School of Biomedical Engineering in West Lafayette, IN, USA. We work at the intersection of surgery and data science, aiming to develop clinically valuable computational tools for personalized patient care in surgery. Our research focuses on two main areas: Preoperative decision support and image-based intraoperative assistance. Combining technical knowledge with a clinical perspective on health and disease and an understanding of legal and regulatory requirements, our goal is to drive the clinical translation of novel technologies in the fields of surgery and interventional medicine.

To learn more about our research, please see our publications, meet our team and check out current opportunities to join the lab.


Our affiliations

Our lab is located at Purdue University’s Weldon School of Biomedical Engineering in West Lafayette, IN, USA. We hold secondary affiliations with the Regenstrief Center for Healthcare Engineering (RCHE) at Purdue University, the Department of Biostatistics and Health Data Science at Indiana University, and the Department of Visceral, Thoracic and Vascular Surgery, University Hospital Carl Gustav Carus at the Technical University Dresden, Germany.
